title: friendy type foundry
content: Any friendly type foundry to submit a typeface design? e.g. P22? FB? Veer? (back then I emailed Linotype — twice or more — and there’s no sign).
author: david hamuel

comments.content:
[Fountain](http://web.archive.org/web/20051111232733/http:/www.fountain.nu/), The Friendly Type Foundry™.. :)

_’..Fountain is an independent and friendly digital type foundry..’  
\> [www.fountain.nu](http://web.archive.org/web/20051111232733/http:/www.fountain.nu/)_

Dav, [formlos](http://web.archive.org/web/20051111232733/http:/www.formlos.net/)
P22 takes submissions through [IHOF](http://web.archive.org/wiki/IHOF). I’d give them a shot. Very friendly people too, if i say so myself!
David, did you e-mail samples to Linotype? Or just questions? I work there, and may be able to help. Please contact me offline by clicking on my icon and using the Typophile “contact.”
What sort of design is it? That can make a difference.

Dan: thank you. Just emailed you.

Stephen: right now — display, decorative, dings (some real woodcuts).
If you want the broadest marketing possible and most appropriate home for that type of work, email Peter Bruhn at [Fountain](http://web.archive.org/wiki/Fountain).

David, I would welcome your consideration to publish your typeface through our [Umbrella](http://web.archive.org/wiki/Umbrella) [1] collection at [Veer](http://web.archive.org/wiki/Veer). However, I agree with Stephen that [Fountain](http://web.archive.org/wiki/Fountain) is probably the _“most appropriate home”_ for your design. As an added bonus, if you do end up being published through Fountain, you will be represented through Veer [2] as well.

[1] [http://www.veer.com/umbrella/](http://web.archive.org/web/20051111232733/http:/www.veer.com/umbrella/)  
[2] [http://www.veer.com/fountain/](http://web.archive.org/web/20051111232733/http:/www.veer.com/fountain/)
